poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Notes go through the syrinx and away
It's a syrinx song, swart and strong enough
To stone the crows and swan off,
To scorn the spawn of writers and their sawn-off
Gnostic snorts.
Who stole your scone?
Who knocks your daily muffin?
Nuffin, said the minister.
The minister said nothing.
